title: Gravitational force - weight of a spacecraft

content.question: On the surface of Earth, a spacecraft has weight <math alttext="F sub g comma E, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>g</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>. The mass and radius of Earth are <math alttext="M sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, respectively. The spacecraft lands on a distant planet, and its weight on the surface of the planet is <math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub g comma E, end sub, and denominator 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mtext>g</mtext><mo>,</mo><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>. Which of the following are possible combinations of mass and radius of the distant planet?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half M sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2 R sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2 R sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="M sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="one half R sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 M sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="one half R sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="M sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2 R sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
